NomaiObject:
<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
CONOY: What have we learned thus far regarding the discrepancy Spire reported?
2
1
PRIVET: While studying meteor impacts during a negative time interval, Spire noticed that there were discrepancies in where meteors fell on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> across several intervals.
3
1
PRIVET: Frustratingly, we remain unable to determine the cause of this discrepancy.. The meteors appear to stray from the path they took in previous intervals randomly, with no discernable consistency.
4
3
CONOY: Hypothesis: if this phenomenon is occuring at random.. Could it be caused by quantum phenomena?
5
4
CONOY: An update: Hypothesis confirmed! Hypothesis confirmed! Meteors appear to stray from expected paths as the Quantum Moon orbits <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow!</color>
6
5
CONOY: As it orbits <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow,</color> the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon's</color> gravity must be pulling on the meteors, causing this discrepancy in where they land across intervals.
7
5
PRIVET: But of course.. Only quantum phenomena could cause such discrepancies in a negative time interval. And at the size of a moon, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> must have sufficient mass to exert gravity as well!
8
7
SPIRE: I never imagined that macroscopic quantum phenomena could affect other celestial bodies in this way.. You have my gratitude for your tireless investigation, my friends!
Workshop R3 8
